intro: Pavetta comostyla, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and often have white or pale pink petals.
